body_html:
Also, I would have thought calling it tf.angle would be nicer than tf.arg, as it then mimics numpy's
np.angle

Conformity is great, but then for API symmetry, tf.abs should also have an alias tf.magnitude that only takes complex numbers, no? It's rather NumPy that goofed by having abs(z) but not arg(z), IMO. Also, angle could refer to a lot of things not related to complex numbers, in my mind.

body:
> Also, I would have thought calling it tf.angle would be nicer than tf.arg, as it then mimics numpy's 
np.angle

Conformity is great, but then for API symmetry, `tf.abs` should also have an alias `tf.magnitude` that only takes complex numbers, no? It's rather NumPy that goofed by having abs(z) but not arg(z), IMO. Also, angle could refer to a lot of things not related to complex numbers, in my mind.
